questions.question: Operating lease: ROU asset $100,000, lease liability $100,000. 5-year term, 6% rate. Year 1 liability payment $23,740. Interest portion $6,000. What is Year 1 ROU amortization?
questions.explanation: Operating lease: total expense is straight-line = $23,740 (payment). Interest = $6,000. Amortization = Total expense - Interest = $23,740 - $6,000 = $17,740.
questions.tip: Operating lease: ROU amort = lease expense - interest expense.

questions.question: Finance lease: ROU asset $100,000 (5-year life, straight-line). Lease liability $100,000 at 6%. What is total Year 1 expense?
questions.tip: Finance lease expense = Amortization + Interest.

questions.question: Acquisition price $2,000,000. Identifiable net assets at FV $1,700,000. What is goodwill?
questions.explanation: Goodwill = Purchase price - FV of identifiable net assets = $2,000,000 - $1,700,000 = $300,000.
questions.tip: Goodwill = Purchase price - FV of net assets acquired.

questions.question: Acquisition price $1,500,000. FV of identifiable net assets $1,800,000. What is recognized?
questions.explanation: When FV of net assets > purchase price, a bargain purchase gain is recognized immediately in income: $1,800,000 - $1,500,000 = $300,000 gain.
questions.tip: FV > Price = bargain purchase gain in income.

questions.question: Reporting unit CV $5,000,000 (including goodwill $800,000). FV $4,500,000. What is the goodwill impairment?
questions.explanation: Impairment = CV - FV = $5,000,000 - $4,500,000 = $500,000. This is less than goodwill ($800,000), so full $500,000 is impaired.
questions.tip: Goodwill impairment = CV - FV (capped at goodwill balance).

questions.question: AFS bonds: Amortized cost $95,000. FV $102,000. What is reported in AOCI?
questions.explanation: Unrealized gain = FV - Amortized cost = $102,000 - $95,000 = $7,000 (reported in OCI).
questions.tip: AFS unrealized = FV - Amortized cost.

questions.question: Contract has outcomes: $500,000 (70% probability) or $400,000 (30% probability). What is expected value?
questions.tip: Expected value = probability-weighted sum of outcomes.

questions.question: Sales $500,000. Expected return rate 4%. What is the refund liability?
questions.explanation: Refund liability = Sales × Return rate = $500,000 × 4% = $20,000.
questions.tip: Refund liability = expected returns × selling price.

questions.question: Asset cost $200,000, salvage $20,000, original 10-year life. After 4 years, remaining life changed to 4 years (total 8 years). What is Year 5 depreciation?
questions.explanation: Original annual depreciation = ($200,000 - $20,000) / 10 = $18,000. After 4 years: Accumulated depreciation = $72,000. Carrying value = $200,000 - $72,000 = $128,000. New remaining life = 4 years. New annual depreciation = ($128,000 - $20,000) / 4 = $108,000 / 4 = $27,000.
questions.tip: Revised depreciation = (CV - Salvage) / New remaining life.

questions.question: Patent acquired for $180,000. Legal life remaining 15 years, useful life 9 years. What is annual amortization?
questions.explanation: Amortize over shorter of legal or useful life = 9 years. Annual = $180,000 / 9 = $20,000.
questions.tip: Intangible amortization: shorter of legal or useful life.

questions.question: Bond CV $485,000 (face $500,000). Called at 102. What is the gain or loss?
questions.tip: Extinguishment G/L = CV - Reacquisition price.

questions.question: Company has 50,000 shares ($5 par, $25 FV). Declares 5% stock dividend. What is credited to Common Stock?
questions.explanation: 5% dividend = 50,000 × 5% = 2,500 shares. Small dividend uses FV but Common Stock at par = 2,500 × $5 = $12,500.
questions.tip: Stock dividend: Common Stock = shares × par value.

questions.question: Company has 100,000 shares at $10 par. After a 2-for-1 split, what is the new par value per share?
questions.explanation: 2-for-1 split doubles shares and halves par. New par = $10 / 2 = $5.
questions.tip: Stock split: shares × multiplier, par ÷ multiplier.

questions.question: Convertible bonds: interest $40,000, convertible to 10,000 shares. Tax rate 25%. What is the EPS numerator adjustment?
questions.tip: Convertible bond adjustment: add back interest × (1 - tax rate).

questions.question: Beginning PBO $2,000,000. Plan assets FV $1,800,000. Unrecognized loss $250,000. Average remaining service 10 years. What is the minimum amortization?
questions.tip: Amortize excess over corridor ÷ remaining service.

questions.question: Purchase orders issued $150,000. Orders received and invoiced $120,000. What are outstanding encumbrances?
questions.explanation: Outstanding encumbrances = Issued - Fulfilled = $150,000 - $120,000 = $30,000.
questions.tip: Outstanding encumbrances = POs issued - POs received.

questions.question: A donor pledges $100,000 payable equally over 5 years. Discount rate 6%. PV annuity factor 4.212. What is recorded as contribution revenue?
questions.explanation: Record at PV: $20,000/year × 4.212 = $84,240. Discount is amortized as contribution revenue over 5 years.
questions.tip: Multi-year pledges: record at present value.

questions.question: New equipment $200,000 (paid in cash). Trade-in value of old equipment $25,000. What is the investing cash outflow?
questions.explanation: Cash paid = $200,000 - $25,000 trade-in = $175,000 investing outflow.
questions.tip: Equipment purchase: report net cash paid.

questions.question: DTL balance $84,000 (calculated at 28%). Rate changes to 21%. What is the new DTL?
questions.tip: Rate change: recalculate at new rate.

questions.question: Beginning inventory $100,000. Purchases $400,000. Sales $600,000. Gross profit rate 40%. What is estimated ending inventory?
questions.tip: Gross profit method: Ending = Available - Estimated COGS.

questions.question: A company has a payable of 50,000 pounds. Rate at purchase: $1.30. Rate at payment: $1.35. What is the exchange gain or loss?
questions.tip: Payable in FC: rate ↑ = loss (pay more $).

questions.question: Land FV $200,000, Building FV $300,000. Total purchase price $400,000. What is allocated to land?
questions.tip: Basket purchase: allocate based on relative FV.

questions.question: Average accumulated expenditures $800,000. Specific construction loan $500,000 at 9%. General borrowings $1,000,000 at 7%. What is avoidable interest?
questions.tip: Avoidable interest = specific rate first, then general rate.

questions.question: ARO liability at end of Year 1: $106,000 (original $100,000 + $6,000 accretion). Credit-adjusted rate 6%. What is Year 2 accretion?
questions.explanation: Year 2 accretion = Year 1 ending balance × Rate = $106,000 × 6% = $6,360.
questions.tip: Accretion = Beginning liability × Credit-adjusted rate.

questions.question: Sales $1,000,000. Estimated warranty rate 3%. Beginning warranty liability $15,000. Claims paid $25,000. What is warranty expense?
questions.explanation: Expense = Sales × Warranty rate = $1,000,000 × 3% = $30,000. This is the accrual; claims paid affect the liability, not expense calculation.
questions.tip: Warranty expense = Sales × Estimated rate.

questions.question: RSUs granted: 5,000 shares at $40 grant-date FV. 3-year cliff vesting. What is Year 1 expense?
questions.tip: RSU expense = FV at grant / vesting period.

questions.question: Cash flow hedge gains $15,000 (effective), $2,000 (ineffective). What is recorded in OCI?
questions.explanation: Effective portion goes to OCI: $15,000. Ineffective portion goes to P&L: $2,000.
questions.tip: Cash flow hedge: effective → OCI, ineffective → P&L.

questions.question: Pretax income $500,000. Tax expense $105,000. What is the effective tax rate?
questions.explanation: Effective rate = Tax expense / Pretax income = $105,000 / $500,000 = 21%.
questions.tip: Effective rate = Tax expense ÷ Pretax income.

questions.question: EBIT $400,000. Interest expense $80,000. What is times interest earned?
questions.explanation: Times interest earned = EBIT / Interest expense = $400,000 / $80,000 = 5.0 times.
questions.tip: TIE = EBIT / Interest.

questions.question: Net sales $2,400,000. Average total assets $1,200,000. What is asset turnover?
questions.explanation: Asset turnover = Net sales / Average total assets = $2,400,000 / $1,200,000 = 2.0 times.
questions.tip: Asset turnover = Sales / Average assets.

questions.question: Gift cards sold $100,000. Expected breakage 5%. Redemptions to date 60%. What breakage revenue is recognized?
questions.explanation: Total breakage = $100,000 × 5% = $5,000. Revenue recognized proportionately: Breakage × (Redemptions / Expected redemptions) = $5,000 × (60% / 95%) = $5,000 × 0.6316 = $3,158.
questions.tip: Breakage recognized proportionately with redemptions.

questions.question: Equity investment CV $400,000. FV $300,000. Decline is other-than-temporary. What is the loss?
questions.tip: Equity method impairment: write down to FV if OTTI.

questions.question: Parent pays $800,000 for 80%. NCI FV $180,000. FV of identifiable net assets $900,000. What is total goodwill?
questions.tip: Full goodwill = (Parent price + NCI FV) - Net assets FV.

questions.question: Under modified accrual, property taxes are recognized as revenue when:

options.A: Levied, if collected within 60 days of year-end

questions.explanation: Property taxes are recognized when levied if measurable and available (collected within 60 days after year-end).
questions.tip: Property taxes: recognize when levied if available (60 days).

questions.question: Total expenses $500,000. Program services 70%, Management 20%, Fundraising 10%. What are program service expenses?
questions.tip: Functional expenses = Total × Category %.
